intro: Vouapa limba, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Vouapa limba is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive indoors with proper care.
